job description:
The Senior Data Scientist is responsible for of data models to meet the needs of the organization. Included in this is the establishment of and adherence to sound data modeling principles and standards.


The Scientist has a strong ability to understand data relationships and can design data models that reflect these relationships with the ability facilitate efficient loading and querying of the data. Additionally the Data Scientist understands the data model within the context of the technical environment and will design a model to leverage the strengths of the technical environment. The Data Scientist is a strong communicator who is eager to learn, endlessly curious, takes pride in hard work and is committed to rapidly advancing his/her career. Additionally, it would be ideal if the Data Scientist has in depth understanding of the mortgage originations industry.

Responsibilities


· Understand and translate business needs into data models supporting long-term solutions.

· Create data models using best practices to ensure high data quality and reduced redundancy.

· Develop best practices for standard naming conventions and coding practices to ensure consistency of data models.

· Recommend opportunities for reuse of data models in new environments.

· Perform reverse engineering of physical data models from databases and SQL scripts.

· Evaluate data models and physical databases for variances and discrepancies.

· Validate business data objects for accuracy and completeness.

· Support ad hoc needs of colleagues within IT and our operational partners by creating database objects and loading data in support of ad hoc analysis and reporting. Participate in peer review of requirements and code review to ensure alignment with

· Analyze data related system integration challenges and propose appropriate solutions.

Advanced knowledge required:

IBM Modeler

Python

R

SQL
2 Years mortgage experience preferred
